result.execSummary:
The defendant Donny R. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: comply with any counseling recommendations of agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donny R. Allen in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. pre-trial was held. offer was provided. Defendant accept offer. Defendant completed Waiver of Right to Atty & Plea Questionnaire. D.A. recommended 12 mo probation. $243 costs plus $100 domestic abuse costs. Counseling & absolute sobriety.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty. Defendant apologized & will make better choices in the future.
Court finds defendant guilty. Sentence withheld. 12 months probation. $243.00 cost plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge. participate with agent for any counseling; absolute sobriety. 24 hrs to report to probation.

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court accepts defendant's waiver of Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return & pre-trial.

with conditions:
*No violent or abusive contact with Sheri Terpstra
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Defendant Donny R. Allen in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold for Sheboygan County.    Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions of No violent or abusive contact with Sheri Terpstra and Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant does not object.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No violent or abusive contact with Sheri Terpstra
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
